revised_title: Extraordinary Effects of Lightning on Buildings and People
tldr: The author describes a series of extraordinary effects of lightning on buildings and people in his neighborhood. He examines the damage caused by lightning to three houses, noting the melting of bell-wires, scorched walls, and burnt objects. He also reports on the effects on people, including a man struck by lightning and a shower of fire-like particles. The author suggests that the particles of the fused wire were actuated by some impellent force, causing the damage and the appearance of a shower of fire.
